---
title: "P-value correction using the Benjamini-Hochberg approach"
---

```{r}


# INPUT SAMPLES
adjusted_p_values <- p.adjust(c(pvalue1, pvalue2, pvalue3), method="BH", number_of_sample_tested)
print(adjusted_p_values)

# Identify significant results at FDR = 0.05
significant <- adjusted_p_values < 0.05
print(significant)

# IP SAMPLES
adjusted_p_values <- p.adjust(c(pvalue1, pvalue2, pvalue3, pvalue4, pvalue5), method="BH", number_of_sample_tested)
print(adjusted_p_values)

# Identify significant results at FDR = 0.05
significant <- adjusted_p_values < 0.05
print(significant)


```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
